ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I think I have a good basic understanding of the Spanish language. I feel confident to converse with native speakers for small amounts of time. I look forward to expanding my knowledge/skill in the next round of class.

Coming into this course, I knew absolutely zero Spanish. Leaving this course, I am conversational, can write short essays, speak with native speakers, and read simple books  all in Spanish. This course have taught me how to learn a new language and helped me develop habits of learning that I was unfamiliar with prior to taking this course.
I was able to learn so much Spanish quickly!
I learned the basics of the Spanish language and grammar.
I learned a lot of Spanish vocabulary and grammar in addition to a lot about different cultures of many Spanish-speaking countries.
As an introductory language course, I developed proficient skills in studying, practicing, and speaking a new language,
Introductory conversations in Spanish and the fundamentals of the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Two strengths are the frequency that course takes place and the fact that it is immersive. Not being able to speak english is fantastic and helps facilitate learning.

This course is very immersive and will force you to take an active role in learning Spanish. There is a lot of work that solidifies your reading and writing abilities in Spanish; however, I feel that there should be more elements of speaking and listening to keep up with the comprehension level.

The course was definitely demanding in terms of time investment, but that's necessary to learn a new language. I think the course could be improved by adding homework worksheets because they would force students to practice the grammar concepts we learned.

This course is meant to really force you to learn Spanish with the amount of daily work. I think I learned so much from it. However, that could also be a weakness because there was assignments in multiple places which caused me to miss some of them and turn them in late.
Not many weaknesses however a large strength was having one asynchronous day every week to catch up on work, review, and prepare.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If youre interested in learning Spanish, yes! This is a great introduction to the Spanish language.
Yes. Spanish is a great language to learn and the Yale Spanish department has great professors and is fair in its demands of students.
Absolutely if they want to learn Spanish.
